LayoutNode.SRC: China Railway Construction Corporation

LayoutNode.Content: Not to be confused with China Railway Engineering Corporation, another railway infrastructure enterprise in the PR China.
LayoutNode.SRC: Not to be confused with China Railway Engineering Corporation, another railway infrastructure enterprise in the PR China.

<th style="text-align: left;" scope="row">Website</th>
China Railway Construction Corporation

LayoutNode.Content: The China Railway Construction Corporation (Chinese: 中國鐵建 or Chinese: 中國鐵道建築總公司, Chinese: 中国铁建 Chinese: 中国铁道建筑总公司), or simply CRCC, is the second largest state-owned construction enterprise in China, just after China Railway Engineering Corporation, and the world's top construction contractor by total revenue in 2012.
LayoutNode.SRC: The China Railway Construction Corporation (Chinese: 中國鐵建 or Chinese: 中國鐵道建築總公司, Chinese: 中国铁建 Chinese: 中国铁道建筑总公司), or simply CRCC, is the second largest state-owned construction enterprise in China, just after China Railway Engineering Corporation, and the world's top construction contractor by total revenue in 2012.

• 1 Corporate structure
• 2 History

• 3 Projects

Corporate structure

LayoutNode.Content: CRCC is under the supervision of the State Council of the People's Republic of China.
LayoutNode.SRC: CRCC is under the supervision of the State Council of the People's Republic of China.

LayoutNode.Content: Since February 2008, A shares and H shares of CRCC are listed on the Shanghai and Hong Kong stock exchanges.
LayoutNode.SRC: Since February 2008, A shares and H shares of CRCC are listed on the Shanghai and Hong Kong stock exchanges.
History

LayoutNode.Content: Formerly the railway arm of the People's Liberation Army, CRCC is engaged in the businesses of construction contracting, surveying, design and consultation, industrial manufacturing, exploitation of real estate, capital operation and logistics.
LayoutNode.SRC: Formerly the railway arm of the People's Liberation Army, CRCC is engaged in the businesses of construction contracting, surveying, design and consultation, industrial manufacturing, exploitation of real estate, capital operation and logistics.

LayoutNode.Content: The company premiered on the Shanghai and Hong Kong in February 2008, raising USD 5.7 billion, making the second largest IPO of that year. The performance was poorer than expected because of poor investment atmosphere from United States subprime mortgage crisis and China's economic macro-control.
LayoutNode.SRC: The company premiered on the Shanghai and Hong Kong in February 2008, raising USD 5.7 billion, making the second largest IPO of that year. The performance was poorer than expected because of poor investment atmosphere from United States subprime mortgage crisis and China's economic macro-control.

LayoutNode.Content: On August 4, 2012 CRCC reached an agreement with F.C. Internazionale Milano: CRCC is the new business partner of the footballteam an will hold about 15% of the club.
LayoutNode.SRC: On August 4, 2012 CRCC reached an agreement with F.C. Internazionale Milano: CRCC is the new business partner of the footballteam an will hold about 15% of the club.

LayoutNode.Content: A team from CRCC in March 2013 joined in the rescue efforts after the worst building collapse in Tanzanian history. The team was praised by the national newspaper for giving the rescue operation Dar es Salaam focus and an urgent pace.
LayoutNode.SRC: A team from CRCC in March 2013 joined in the rescue efforts after the worst building collapse in Tanzanian history. The team was praised by the national newspaper for giving the rescue operation Dar es Salaam focus and an urgent pace.
Projects
2008

LayoutNode.Content: Libya - CRCC wins $2.6b bid for west-to-east coastal railway 352 km from Khoms to Sirte and a south-to-north railway 800 km long for iron ore transport from the southern city Sabha to Misrata.
LayoutNode.SRC: • Libya - CRCC wins $2.6b bid for west-to-east coastal railway 352 km from Khoms to Sirte and a south-to-north railway 800 km long for iron ore transport from the southern city Sabha to Misrata.
2009

LayoutNode.Content: Saudi Arabia - CRCC wins 6.7 billion Saudi riyal contract to build the first 18 km of the metro in Mecca
LayoutNode.SRC: • Saudi Arabia - CRCC wins 6.7 billion Saudi riyal contract to build the first 18 km of the metro in Mecca
2012

LayoutNode.Content: The new football stadium of F.C. Internazionale Milano in San Donato Milanese, which will cost about 250 million €, will be built by CRCC. End of construction: 2017 (estimated).
LayoutNode.SRC: • The new football stadium of F.C. Internazionale Milano in San Donato Milanese, which will cost about 250 million €, will be built by CRCC. End of construction: 2017 (estimated).
2013

LayoutNode.Content: Hawalli Al Asimah Al Farwaniyah Al Ahmadi Al Jahra Mubarak Al-Kabeer
LayoutNode.SRC: Hawalli Al Asimah Al Farwaniyah Al Ahmadi Al Jahra Mubarak Al-Kabeer
Governorates of Kuwait

LayoutNode.Content: The Kuwait Bowling Club Car Parking for Public Authority of Youth and Sports in Salmiya, which will cost about 4 million KWD, will be built by CRCC. End of construction: 2014.
LayoutNode.SRC: The Kuwait Bowling Club Car Parking for Public Authority of Youth and Sports in Salmiya, which will cost about 4 million KWD, will be built by CRCC. End of construction: 2014.
